item.title: Amanda add a quote by Leah Stewart
item.description: "Here was the secret of this house, the thing it took bravery to face -- that to go on loving someone means to over and over again allow the necessary pain. " -- Leah Stewart

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "What's the world's greatest lie?... It's this: that at a certain point in our lives, we lose control of what's happening to us, and our lives become controlled by fate." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Probably I dont believe in a lot of things that I used to believe in but that doesnt mean I dont believe in anything." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "People said things they didn't mean all the time. Everybody else in the world seemed able to factor it in. But not Lena. Why did she believe the things people said? Why did she cling to them so literally? Why did she think she knew people when she clearly didn't? Why did she imagine that the world didn't change, when it did? Maybe she didn't change. She believed what people said and she stayed the same." (Lena, 211)" -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "It was frustrating when people loved you and took an interest in you and sometimes worried about you and personally cared what you did with yourself. Lena wished that love were something you could flip on and off. You could turn it on when you felt good bout yourself and worthy of it and generous enough to return it. You could clip it off when you needed to hide or self-destruct and had nothing at all to give." (Lena, 194)" -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "One likes to think there's something in it, that old platitude amor vincit omnia. But if I've learned one thing in my short sad life, it is that that particular platitude is a lie. Love doesn't conquer everything. And whoever thinks it does is a fool." -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Mindy Kaling
item.description: "Teenage girls, please don’t worry about being super popular in high school, or being the best actress in high school, or the best athlete. Not only do people not care about any of that the second you graduate, but when you get older, if you reference your successes in high school too much, it actually makes you look kind of pitiful, like some babbling old Tennessee Williams character with nothing else going on in her current life. What I’ve noticed is that almost no one who was a big star in high school is also big star later in life. For us overlooked kids, it’s so wonderfully fair." -- Mindy Kaling

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Mindy Kaling
item.description: "The chorus of “Jack and Diane” is: Oh yeah, life goes on, long after the thrill of living is gone. Are you kidding me? The thrill of living was high school? Come on, Mr. Cougar Mellencamp. Get a life." -- Mindy Kaling

item.title: Amanda add a quote by David Levithan
item.description:
"Love doesn’t have to be on Valentine’s Day. It doesn’t have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn’t have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn’t have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third day.
It just has to be. In time. In place. In spirt.
It just has to be." -- David Levithan

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "So many people enter and leave your life! Hundreds of thousands of people! You have to keep the door open so they can come in! But it also means you have to let them go!" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Lauren Fox
item.description: "The person who knew you best when you were seventeen will always have a claim on you, no matter how much you change. There's something seductive and magnetic about it, the feeling of being understood like that. I suppose it goes both ways." (19)" -- Lauren Fox

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Lauren Fox
item.description: "We all think we're snowflakes, but we're Tinker Toys, held together by our interchangeable parts. (39)" -- Lauren Fox

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jonathan Tropper
item.description: "Childhood feels so permanent, like it's the entire world, and then one day it's over and you're shoveling wet dirt onto your father's coffin, stunned at the impermanence of everything." -- Jonathan Tropper

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jonathan Tropper
item.description: "It would be a terrible mistake to go through life thinking that people are the sum total of what you see." -- Jonathan Tropper

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Leah Stewart
item.description: "And Josh wanted to tell her what he knew: that love might look like a shore but turn out to be a desert island, where you roamed alone, talking to yourself, trying to crack open coconuts with your shoe. So thirsty you drank the salt water. So hungry you ate the sand." -- Leah Stewart

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Leah Stewart
item.description: "You like being in love with someone who’s not going to love you back.” She opened her eyes. He looked at her. “Why would I like that?” she asked. He shrugged. “I don’t know." -- Leah Stewart

item.title: Amanda add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "This is what love does: It makes you want to rewrite the world. It makes you want to choose the characters, build the scenery, guide the plot. The person you love sits across from you, and you want to do everything in your power to make it possible, endlessly possible. And when it’s just the two of you, alone in a room, you can pretend that this is how it is, this is how it will be." -- David Levithan

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "Sometimes it's just better to suck up the fact that you are an asshole and decide that tomorrow is the day you will start being the person you intend to be." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "Beautiful gay men are God's gift to women. They're like a consolation prize for ...well, for everything else about being a woman." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "There are things you do when you are a teenager, or a dancer, or just a girl, I guess. You cut your food up in special ways, or you cut yourself, or paper dolls. You pretend that there is an invisible audience watching you all the time, and you do things to impress them or pretend that they didn’t see what you just did because their live video feed was interrupted somehow. You steal things or tell lies or speak to strangers in a Russian accent. You have sex with someone you love, or with someone who gets you really drunk. You lie to your parents, your boyfriend, yourself, your therapist. You cheat on your homework or do other people’s homework for money. You get up, you take class, you rehearse, you perform, you go to bed. How do you decide which of these things are truly crazy and which are just being alive?" -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "I cannot bear this love. Nor the loss of it." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "And I had forgotten to get more Sweet’N Low, so I had to drink coffee as bitter as I am." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "What I was thinking, in that strange way you can think without words while you are dancing, think in glyphs, think in numbers, was how stupid it is that any of us are here, living. What an absurd game we play with ourselves, as if it mattered. We are all mad, all insane, all deluded. It is all for nothing, really, in the end." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "...the overture began. God! Strings! Oboes! Timpani! Are you fucking kidding me? Why, when we know what human beings are capable of doing, do we not turn our collective heads in shame at the sight of rich housewives screaming at each other on television?" -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "I should think people would be disappointed if they watched that kind of movie and then came to see us dance and none of us slit our wrists onstage or made ourselves vomit or got on the backs of motorcycles while wearing tutus and started fucking each other." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Meg Howrey
item.description: "...needing people and caring about them were two very different things." -- Meg Howrey

item.title: Amanda add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough." -- David Levithan

item.title: Amanda add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else." -- David Foster Wallace
